text: Ronald Arthur Silver (July 2, 1946 â€“ March 15, 2009) was an American actor, activist, director, producer, and radio host. He played Henry Kissinger, Alan Dershowitz and Angelo Dundee. He won a Tony in 1988 for Best Actor for Speed- the-Plow. Silver was born in New York City. From 1991 to 2000, he was President of the Actors' Equity Association.
